Internal API

These functions are public but not exported. You can use them to define new AMM types or for specialized applications, but in general, the AMM / trading curve functions will be more convenient

ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.mk_tc — Function
mk_tc(common::TCCommon) <: TradingCurve

Create a certain trading curve object from an AMM and common data. Must be specialized to the concrete type of common. This is how we capture the relationship from AMMs to TradingCurve's

Required.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.lt_vp — Function
lt_vp(amm, v, p)

Compute the invariant and balances at a given portfolio value (in units of the y asset) and price.

The fallback implementation requires t_l_p and scales the invariant from L=1.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.residual — Function
residual(amm, l, t)
residual(tc, t)

Invariant residual at the given invariant l and balances t. This is 0 iff t is on the given trading curve.

TODO Required? Should be differentiable.

source

The following functions query information from AMMs. They are supported but you usually want to create a TradingCurve instead and query that.

ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.t_l_p — Function
t_l_p(amm, l, p)

Balances at the given invariant l and price p.

Required.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.l_t — Function
l_t(amm, t)

Invariant at the given balances t.

Required.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.p_l_t — Function
p_l_t(amm, l, t)

Price at the given invariant l and balances t.

Required.

source

Other interface functions

ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.display_params — Function
display_params(::AMM; as_bp::Bool)

Must return a list of pairs of strings, for display only. Used in the default implementation of short_str().

Required.

source

AMM wrappers

ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.AMMWithMeta — Type

An AMM with metadata of type M attached. Often, M = PlotMeta.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.TradingCurveWithMeta — Type

A TradingCurve with metadata of type M attached. Often, M = PlotMeta.

source
ConstantFunctionMarketMakers.ConcentratedAMM — Type

Generic concentrated AMM, using numerical methods to solve the required equations.

Note: concentrate() uses knowledge about some AMMs to yield more efficient versions. ConcentratedAMM() always uses the AMM as an approximate black box. (though some optimization/parameter choice may depend on the inner AMM)

source
